actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Referred to Subcommittee on Compensation, Pension and Insurance.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Compensation, Pension and Insurance

official_title: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize a service pension of up to $150 per month for veterans of World War I and for certain surviving spouses and dependent children of such veterans.
short_title: World War I Veterans Service Pension Act

summary.text: World War I Veterans Service Pension Act of 1981 - Requires the Administrator of Veterans' Affairs to pay (in addition to any pension already paid) a monthly pension of $150: (1) to each veteran of World War I who meets specified service requirements; (2) to the surviving spouse of each such veteran; or (3) when there is no surviving spouse, to the child or children of each such veteran.

titles.title: World War I Veterans Service Pension Act

A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize a service pension of up to $150 per month for veterans of World War I and for certain surviving spouses and dependent children of such veterans.
